DataElement.preferredName: Serum Albumin Laboratory Procedure Performed Outcome Integer::2 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 2 decimal place numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of serum albumin in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins._A family of globular proteins found in many plant and animal tissues that tend to bind a wide variety of ligands.  Albumin is the main protein in blood plasma.  Low serum levels occur in conditions associated with malnutrition, inflammation and liver and kidney diseases._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.:family of globular proteins found in many plant and animal tissues that tend to bind a wide variety of ligands.:A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.

A family of globular proteins found in many plant and animal tissues that tend to bind a wide variety of ligands.  Albumin is the main protein in blood plasma.  Low serum levels occur in conditions associated with malnutrition, inflammation and liver and kidney diseases.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::2 Decimal Place Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::2 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.:A number with no fractional part.::2:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
